## FIO-10304 / 10305 / 10306 / 10307 — Point of destination (simplified acceptance criteria)

Summary
-------
Add a free-text "Point of destination" field underneath the existing "Consignment destination" field for the non-manipulation journey for these transport modes: truck, plane, train and container-vessel. Ensure field validation, error messages, Welsh translations, non-JS behaviour and accessibility.

Field behaviour (common)
-----------------------
- Label: "Point of destination"
- Guidance: "For example, Calais port, Calais-Dunkerque airport or the destination point of the consignment."
- Input type: free text
- Validation rules (applies on Save and continue):
  - Required — if empty, show field-level error and add to error summary: `Enter the point of destination`.
  - Max length 100 characters — if exceeded, show: `Point of destination must not exceed 100 characters`.
  - Allowed characters only: letters, numbers, hyphens (-), apostrophes ('), spaces and forward slashes (/). If other chars present show: `Point of destination must only contain letters, numbers, hyphens, apostrophes, spaces and forward slashes`.
  - On validation failure, details are NOT saved and the `UK departure transport details` progress section is marked `Incomplete`.

Save as draft behaviour (mode-specific)
------------------------------------
- Truck:
  - If the value is invalid (too long or invalid chars) and the user clicks **Save as draft**, do not save the point of destination and navigate to `/create-processing-statement/processing-statements`.
- Plane, Train, Container-vessel:
  - If invalid and user clicks **Save as draft**, do not save the point of destination and navigate to `/create-storage-document/storage-documents`.

Pages / routes affected
----------------------
- Truck: `/add-transportation-details-truck`
- Plane: `/add-transportation-details-plane`
- Train: `/add-transportation-details-train`
- Container: `/add-transportation-details-container-vessel`

Scenarios (condensed)
----------------------
For each of the pages above, the following scenarios apply (repeat per mode):

1) Field exists
   - On page load the `Point of destination` field appears under `Consignment destination` with the guidance text.

2) Not populated (Save and continue)
   - If empty: show field error `Enter the point of destination`, include in error summary, do not save, progress marked `Incomplete`.

3) Too long (Save and continue)
   - If > 100 chars: show `Point of destination must not exceed 100 characters`, include in error summary, do not save, progress marked `Incomplete`.

4) Invalid characters (Save and continue)
   - If contains characters outside allowed set: show `Point of destination must only contain letters, numbers, hyphens, apostrophes, spaces and forward slashes`, include in error summary, do not save, progress marked `Incomplete`.

5) Invalid but Save as draft
   - If invalid and user clicks **Save as draft**: do NOT save the value; navigate to appropriate page (truck -> processing statements; others -> storage documents).

6) Welsh translations
   - When Welsh is selected all text (label, guidance, error messages) must be translated.

7) Non-JS
   - The page must work when JavaScript is disabled — server-side validation, error summary and inline field errors must be present.

8) Accessibility
   - Page must follow GDS accessibility guidelines: correct heading hierarchy, error summary ARIA roles, form field labels and descriptions, keyboard navigation.

Translations (English ⇄ Welsh)
-----------------------------
| English text | Welsh translation |
|---|---|
| Point of destination | Cyrchfan |
| For example, Calais port, Calais-Dunkerque airport or the destination point of the consignment. | Er enghraifft, porthladd Calais, maes awyr Calais-Dunkerque neu gyrchfan y llwyth. |
| Enter the point of destination | Rhowch y gyrchfan |
| Point of destination must not exceed 100 characters | Rhaid i’r gyrchfan fod yn llai na 100 o nodau |
| Point of destination must only contain letters, numbers, hyphens, apostrophes, spaces and forward slashes | Rhaid i’r gyrchfan gynnwys llythrennau, rhifau, cysylltnodau, collnodau, bylchau a blaenslaesau yn unig |

Developer notes
---------------
- Add the field under the `Consignment destination` field in the transport-details components for each mode.
- Reuse existing form components and server-side validation helpers where possible.
- Ensure server-side validation matches client-side constraints (required, length, allowed chars) so Non-JS works.
- On validation failure do not persist the invalid value and keep progress marked as Incomplete.
- Ensure the **Save as draft** redirect pages match the behaviour above.

QA checklist
------------
- [ ] Field present with guidance on each affected page (truck, plane, train, container-vessel).
- [ ] Required validation shows inline + error summary and does not save data.
- [ ] Length validation (100 chars) shows correct message, does not save data.
- [ ] Character validation enforces allowed set and shows correct message.
- [ ] Save-as-draft does not save invalid value and navigates to the mode-specific page.
- [ ] Welsh translations appear correctly when `?lng=cy` or Welsh is selected.
- [ ] Page works fully with JavaScript disabled.
- [ ] Page passes basic GDS accessibility checks (headings, labels, error summary ARIA roles).

Acceptance mapping
------------------
- FIO-10304 — Truck page behaviours and redirects
- FIO-10305 — Plane page behaviours and redirects
- FIO-10306 — Train page behaviours and redirects
- FIO-10307 — Container-vessel page behaviours and redirects

Contact / follow-ups
--------------------
- Clarify if any mode needs a different character whitelist. Current whitelist: letters, numbers, hyphen (-), apostrophe ('), space, forward slash (/).
- Confirm exact Save-as-draft redirect pages if they change from the spec above.
